intro: Centaurea fuliginosa, commonly known as the sooty centaury, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It is characterized by its dark purple to blackish flowers and hairy, glandular leaves. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky, or sandy soils and is often found in Mediterranean climates. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is known for its showy, composite flower heads. Centaurea fuliginosa is often used in gardens for its ornamental value and can thrive in well-drained conditions.
